description: Returns detailed compliance information about the specified member account. Details include resources that are in and out of compliance with the specified policy. The reasons for resources being considered compliant depend on the Firewall Manager policy type.

parameters.name: PolicyId
parameters.description: The ID of the policy that you want to get the details for. PolicyId is returned by PutPolicy and by ListPolicies.

parameters.name: MemberAccount
parameters.description: The Amazon Web Services account that owns the resources that you want to get the details for.

nested_items.name: PolicyComplianceDetail
nested_items.description: Information about the resources and the policy that you specified in the GetComplianceDetail request.

nested_items.name: PolicyOwner
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account that created the Firewall Manager policy.

nested_items.name: PolicyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Firewall Manager policy.

nested_items.name: MemberAccount
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID.

nested_items.name: Violators
nested_items.description: An array of resources that aren't protected by the WAF or Shield Advanced policy or that aren't in compliance with the security group policy.

nested_items.name: ViolationReason
nested_items.description: The reason that the resource is not protected by the policy.

nested_items.name: ResourceType
nested_items.description: The resource type. This is in the format shown in the Amazon Web Services Resource Types Reference. For example: AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer, AWS::CloudFront::Distribution, or AWS::NetworkFirewall::FirewallPolicy.

nested_items.name: EvaluationLimitExceeded
nested_items.description: Indicates if over 100 resources are noncompliant with the Firewall Manager policy.

nested_items.name: ExpiredAt
nested_items.description: A timestamp that indicates when the returned information should be considered out of date.

nested_items.name: IssueInfoMap
nested_items.description: Details about problems with dependent services, such as WAF or Config, and the error message received that indicates the problem with the service.
